# Pediatrics Calculators Sources

## Licensing Note
These rules and formulas are derived from published research and public domain sources and are freely implementable with proper citation.

## PECARN Head Injury Rule
- Kuppermann N, et al. Identification of children at very low risk of clinically-important brain injuries after head trauma. Lancet. 2009;374(9696):1160-1170. DOI: 10.1016/S0140-6736(09)61558-0.
- PECARN open-access PDF of the 2009 Lancet study (pecarn.org).

## CDC Growth Charts
- Kuczmarski RJ, et al. 2000 CDC Growth Charts for the United States: Methods and Development. NCHS Vital Health Stat 11(246), May 2002. (CDC NCHS PDF).
- CDC Growth Charts background and methodology (cdc.gov/growthcharts).
- CDC Growth Charts data files (CDC Growth Charts data files page).

## WHO Growth Standards
- WHO Child Growth Standards release (27 April 2006) and documentation on WHO child growth standards (who.int).
- WHO Multicentre Growth Reference Study (MGRS) documentation (who.int/tools/child-growth-standards).
- CDC WHO growth chart data files (NCHS distribution of WHO standards).

## Pediatric Weight-Based Dosing Rules
- StatPearls (NCBI Bookshelf): Clark's Rule (weight-based formula).
- StatPearls (NCBI Bookshelf): Young's Rule (age-based formula; references Fried's rule).

## Holliday-Segar Formula
- Holliday MA, Segar WE. The maintenance need for water in parenteral fluid therapy. Pediatrics. 1957;19(5):823-832. DOI: 10.1542/peds.19.5.823.

## Parkland Formula
- Baxter CR, Shires T. Physiological response to crystalloid resuscitation of severe burns. Ann N Y Acad Sci. 1968;150(3):874-894. DOI: 10.1111/j.1749-6632.1968.tb14738.x. PubMed: 4973463.
